noun.description: A portion of a larger whole, especially a sample taken for chemical analysis or other treatment.
examples: an aliquot was examined daily for the appearance of cholesterol monohydrate crystals

verb.description: Divide (a whole) into aliquots; take aliquots from (a whole)
examples: this solution was then aliquoted for three separate mass spectrometer analyses

origin: Late 16th century: from French aliquote, from Latin aliquot some, so many, from alius one of two + quot how many.
